node.display_long_description:
“This is the kind of social videogame Oculus Quest was made for.” - VRFocus
“... offers up everything that I could ask for in an immersive VR experience." - 
TheGamer

Get Your Aprons Ready… Things Are About To Get Messy!

Set within the cook’s cabin of a fairytale forest, Cook-Out: A Sandwich Tale is a wacky and whimsical adventure that challenges up to four players to work together to keep the orders coming for a cast of enchanted creatures in this multiplayer VR title from Resolution Games.

As players progress through increasingly hectic levels, they not only prepare meals but also need to fight off a number of nasty customers who seem absolutely set on making trouble -- like jesters who hide parts of orders, or thieves who keep pilfering ingredients.

While the game is focused on cooperative play, solo players will be able to enjoy the experience with the help of a simulated partner, making sure there’s always a team to tackle tough orders and restore the calm to this wild kitchen

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
New Features:
Animal avatars eyes are now animated

Bug fixes:
Avatar hands now syncs better over network.
Fixed occasional infinite loading on Avatars menu preventing players from choosing different avatars
Fixed broken Splash Screen on Quest
Fixed several network bugs that could cause customers and plates to break
Fixed bug that made any grabbable item disappear if a player left the game holding said item
Fixed bug preventing use of Vive Cosmos controllers

Game changes:
Valve Index controllers grip input has been tweaked to be more responsive.
Valve Index controllers now have haptics enabled.
Added another hand pose for animal avatars so it is not so easy to accidentally do an OK-sign.

nodes.title: Game Update
nodes.body_text:
We hope you’ve been enjoying the animal chef avatars. With our recent update, the animal avatars eyes are now animated.

Here’s a few other updates:

Bug fixes:
- Avatar hands now syncs better over network.
- Fixed occasional infinite loading on Avatars menu preventing players from choosing different avatars
- Fixed broken Splash Screen on Quest
- Fixed several network bugs that could cause customers and plates to break
- Fixed bug sometimes preventing use of Vive Cosmos controllers

Game changes:
- Valve Index controllers grip input has been tweaked to be more responsive.
- Valve Index controllers now have haptics enabled.
- Added another hand pose for animal avatars so it is not so easy to accidentally do an OK-sign.

nodes.title: New Animal Avatars
nodes.body_text:
Have you visited the Cook-Out kitchen today? We just released brand new chef avatars so you can play as your spirit animal. Choose between six lovable and quirky characters.

Starting today you can also play with your PCVR friends on Steam via cross-play, so make sure to invite them to your next game session.

We also included balancing updates and bug fixes. You can find the full patch-notes on our Discord server.

Follow us on Twitter for more news!

node.reviewDescription: This is a great game but let’s remember not only adults are playing this game. My 5 year old likes to play and as we all know 5 years old don’t like to play by the rules. So if someone is doing something you don’t like please just kick them instead of yelling get the f-out at them! Maybe create kids only servers. Thanks
node.reviewTitle: Good game but please be nicer!!!!

website_page_meta.description:
Get Your Aprons Ready… Things Are About To Get Messy!

In Cook-Out: A Sandwich Tale, players of Resolution Games’ multiplayer VR game work together to cook their way through a wacky and whimsical adventure to keep the customers happy and progress through increasingly hectic levels. But don’t dish it if you can’t take it, because these customers mean business.
website_page_meta.title: Cook-Out · Oculus Quest
